t: The King Rejoices in the Lord’s Strength
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s in your strength the king rejoices, and*ld in your salvation how greatly he exults!
You*ln have given him his heart’s desire and*ld have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah*ig
For*ln you meet him with rich blessings; you*ld set a crown of fine gold upon his head.
He*ln asked life of you; you gave it to him, length*ld of days forever and ever.
His*ln glory is great through your salvation; splendor*ld and majesty you bestow on him.
For*ln you make him most blessed forever; you*ld make him glad with the joy of your presence.
For*ln the king trusts in the Lord,*s and*ld through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.
Your*pn hand will find out all your enemies; your*ld right hand will find out those who hate you.
You*ln will make them as a blazing oven when*ld you appear. The*ln Lord*s will swallow them up in his wrath, and*ld fire will consume them.
You*ln will destroy their descendants from the earth, and*ld their offspring from among the children of man.
Though*ln they plan evil against you, though*ld they devise mischief, they will not succeed.
For*ln you will put them to flight; you*ld will aim at their faces with your bows.
Be*pn exalted, O Lord,*s in your strength! We*ld will sing and praise your power.
